text: we've only seen one ambulance leave
today with the lights flashing we saw
four of those yesterday so it looks like
someone else at least has certainly been
brought out of the cave and is on their
way to hospital we understand they've
used one of the helicopters which is
stationed just down the end of the road
here where there's some flat land but we
haven't had official confirmation that
that is a fifth boy who was in that
ambulance the the way that this news was
released yesterday was mainly via the
Navy SEALs webpage and has been no
update on there today so officially
according to that source the number
still stands at four but there are
widespread reports that a fifth boy has
come out and that maybe even more are
about to follow so it seems this rescue
operation is progressing and that there
may be more success to celebrate today
but certainly there's more to do as well
because this is a really slow-moving
operation which is being carried out
very carefully to minimize the risks
they come out so they immediately
reunited with their family no they're
not the families have kept a vigil here
close to the cave entrance for the last
two weeks but when this rescue attempt
really got underway yesterday they were
told to go and wait near the hospital in
Chiang Rai the main town which is about
an hour's drive from here obviously
quicker if they're ferried there via
helicopter but the families are waiting
in Chiang Rai and even the four boys who
were freed yesterday and taken to
hospital they're being cared for there
today and we're told they're well
although they are in quarantine I think
that's a precaution that Thai officials
want to be very careful with so they the
families haven't even been able to talk
to them yet we understand they haven't
been properly reunited and now that's
obviously very difficult they've been
apart for so long already parents will
have been so worried and so anxious so
keen to see their young boys again but
the operation is being run very tightly
very carefully officials wanting to do
everything properly here to make sure
that these boys are safe they've been
through such an ordeal and it's going to
take so much longer for them to get over
it even once they are freed from the
cave a lot more work to do here and much
more effort required to bring this to a
successful conclusion for everyone
involved
thank you very much done
